info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 4 at 12:45AM CDT until July 4 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
At 1245 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Black River Falls, Price, Millston, Hatfield, Franklin, York, Irving, Northfield, Merrillan, Alma Center, Levis, Taylor, Hixton, City Point, Sand Pillow, The Majestic Pines Casino, Vaudreuil, Lake Wazee, Castle Mound and Perry Creek Recreation Area.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR JACKSON COUNTY
